text:
Hello everyone!
I use hubdb tables to put content in blog posts.
Today, the cached, prerendered posts look like the hubdb requests found nothing.
If I check the editor or the not-prerendered pages, it works like a charm.
If I manually re-publish, it works. But if I try to do it via API, the cache isn't cleared and the page stays with empty boxes.

Edit: I even tried to change a module used in all blog posts and push it to prod, the prerendered posts are still missing info

APIs used:
 `patch <https://api.hubapi.com/cms/v3/blogs/posts/{blog_post_id}>` with `state: 'PUBLISHED'`
and `post <https://app.HubSpot.com/api/blogs/v3/blog-posts/#{blog_post_id}/publish-action>` with `action: "schedule-publish"`

Note that I'm not close to the limit of hubdb calls per page.

Did it happen to anyone else? Any idea to fix this?

Hi everyone!
I'm trying to reproduce HubSpots open rate calculation via the data available in the public API tables. I'm having a hard time reproducing their open rate calck bc HubSpots open rate calc nets out bot opens from the open rate. Does anyone know where opens net of bots are stored in public API tables?
